label: 過所
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: a travel pass used to secure passage through an official barrier (seki 関). In classical times officials requested such passes from their superiors (honshi 本司), while commoners requested them from their district chieftain (gunji). In medieval times, barriers turned into toll booths operated for economic benefit. [郡司]
